item.title: Report X-2024070182
item.description:
Report X-2024070182

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was found in the truck by the package handler from the night previous night. The package handler didn't notice the hazmat on the package because the label evaporated, and the box was torn and crushed. We had to research for the label and thankfully matched the package with the UN Number associated with the bottle. The two bottles that had ethanolamine, were found leaking from the bottom of the bottle. Seem as though there was no inner packing inside the package to protect the product. Being placed in a red bin and being held at the station. More pictures provided for additional information.

item.title: Report X-2024061550
item.description:
Report X-2024061550

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-08
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Package was on a 53 trailer with other packages surrounded by another hazmat. The package had effected multiple people that was around the strong smell. The facility did the proper procedure and filed all who were affected. The specialist was called by the facility and the Hazmat package is no longer in building for additional information.
